dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S1280 IS: Down East Remembrance Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Tillis (for himself and Mr. Budd) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

form.official-title: To designate six creeks in North Carolina in honor of the lives lost in a plane crash in Carteret County, North Carolina, on February 13, 2022, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Down East Remembrance Act.

subsection.text: The creek located at latitude 34°59′49.33′′ N, longitude 76°8′42.11′′ W, shall be known and designated as Noah Styron Creek.
The creek located at latitude 34°57′52.85′′ N, longitude 76°11′11.25′′ W, shall be known and designated as Hunter Parks Creek.
The creek located at latitude 34°57′46.30′′ N, longitude 76°11′18.18′′ W, shall be known and designated as Kole McInnis Creek.
The creek located at latitude 34°57′38.08′′ N, longitude 76°11′31.18′′ W, shall be known and designated as Stephanie Fulcher Creek.
The creek located at latitude 34°52′43.45′′ N, longitude 76°17′41.49′′ W, shall be known and designated as Jacob Taylor Creek.
The creek located at latitude 34°52′28.26′′ N, longitude 76°17′43.20′′ W, shall be known and designated as Daily Shepherd Creek.

Any reference in any law, regulation, document, record, map, or other paper of the United States to a creek described in this section shall be considered a reference to that creek as it is designated under this section.
